text: Scott Curry (born 17 May 1988) is a New Zealand rugby union player. He plays for the New Zealand national rugby sevens team. He made his debut at the 2010 Dubai Sevens. Curry was ruled out of the All Blacks Sevens squad to the 2013 Rugby World Cup Sevens in Russia due to an injury he sustained during training. He was included in the squad for the 2014 Commonwealth Games in Glasgow. However, New Zealand lost to South Africa 12–17 in the final. Curry captained the All Blacks Sevens side at the 2015 USA Sevens after DJ Forbes was injured in Wellington. He will captain the side at the 2016 Summer Olympics. He is a trained science teacher. ==References== ==External links== * All Blacks Profile * Category:1988 births Category:Living people Category:New Zealand international rugby sevens players Category:Rugby sevens players at the 2016 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic rugby sevens players of New Zealand Category:Commonwealth Games rugby sevens players of New Zealand Category:Rugby sevens players at the 2014 Commonwealth Games Category:New Zealand male rugby sevens players Category:Commonwealth Games medallists in rugby sevens Category:Commonwealth Games silver medallists for New Zealand Category:Rugby sevens players at the 2018 Commonwealth Games Category:Commonwealth Games gold medallists for New Zealand
title: Scott Curry (rugby union)
